body_html:
Seems reasonable. I dug around into the history of this flag. It seems that in CUDA6 and earlier this flag was required to be zero, and there have been a few bugs related to buffer flushing (e.g. losing the last trace record in the buffer).

Since (I think) we no longer need to support cuda versions < 7 this seems like a sensible change to me.

Could you please submit a PR?
body_text:
Seems reasonable.  I dug around into the history of this flag.  It seems that in CUDA6 and earlier this flag was required to be zero, and there have been a few bugs related to buffer flushing (e.g. losing the last trace record in the buffer).
Since (I think) we no longer need to support cuda versions < 7 this seems like a sensible change to me.
Could you please submit a PR?
body:
Seems reasonable.  I dug around into the history of this flag.  It seems that in CUDA6 and earlier this flag was *required* to be zero, and there have been a few bugs related to buffer flushing (e.g. losing the last trace record in the buffer).

Since (I think) we no longer need to support cuda versions < 7 this seems like a sensible change to me.

Could you please submit a PR?
